attributes.action: provide help in stopping the use of child soldiers in Uganda through providing assistance to the Ugandan authorities in the arrest of the leader of the rebel army Joseph Kony. And raise awareness of this issue within the British public.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The longest running war in Africa is still ongoing; many children have
been abducted in Northern Uganda and the Kongo to be forced into becoming child soldiers for the rebel army
LRA; which is led by Joseph Kony. 

There is an American charity established called "Invisible Children" to help the situation in Africa. Although real military help is required to find Joseph Kony and bring him to justice. The International Criminal Court has a warrant against his name and he needs to be brought to justice so there will be peace in Uganda and children will not be abducted and forced into fighting a war.

We petition the British government to help the Ugandan authorities find and arrest Joseph Kony and raise this issue with the United Nations. We also petition the government to help bring peace in Uganda as well as raising awareness of this issue within the British public.
